00040 /** 
00041  * CallSet::CallSet
00042  * Synopsis
00043  *
00044  * 1.) Default constructor for STL containers.
00045  * 2.) Translation table constructor used in "TranslationTable.cpp".
00046  * 
00047  * @param name - the allele or marker name "*1". 
00048  * @param columnInTranslationTable - A1-ANN index, "Ref" or "Var" index
00049  * for markers. 
00050  * 
00051  */
00052 /*****************************************************************************/
00053 CallSet::CallSet(const std::string & name, const int & columnInTranslationTable ) :  m_columnInTranslationTable(columnInTranslationTable), m_name(name)
00054 {
00055   m_isDescriptive        = false;
00056   m_isMultiAllelic       = false;
00057   m_hasWildCards         = false;
00058   m_type                 = ADT_CALL_TYPE_NULL;
00059   m_copyNumber           = 2;
00060   m_hasZeroCopyNumberNotAvailable = false;
00061 }
00062 /*****************************************************************************/
00063 /*****************************************************************************/
00064 /**
00065  * CallSet::CallSet
00066  * Synopsis:
00067  * 
00068  * Constructor for CHP experiment data to be compared with translation table
00069  * call sets instantiated with the other constructor. 
00070  * A call set represents one of two possible chromatids.
00071  *
00072  * The GenoTypeTableModel experiment data from the CHP file is
00073  * passed in preconfigured to a projection of sorted markers for
00074  * one particular gene. Further the reference set represents
00075  * all the probesets (markers) to be included for this gene call set.
00076  *   For a SNP, all the gene markers are scanned but only one is used.
00077  * If a haplotype group for, say, "*7", requires six markers then
00078  * all gene markers are scanned and only the six are used. 
00079  *
00080  * This constructor could be improved by building a probe set index (std::map)
00081  * in the GenotypeTableModel. 
00082  *
00083  * 
00084  *
00085  * @param rte          - The single instance RunTimeEnvironment
00086  * @param gtm          - The single instance experiment model 
00087  * @param referenceSet - The reference set of accepted probeSets for this
00088  *                      experiment gene (from the Translation Table).
00089  *
00090  * @param chromoTid - 1 or 2.
00091  */
00092 /*****************************************************************************/
00093 CallSet::CallSet(const class RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00094                  class GenotypeTableModel & gtm,
00095                  const CallSet & referenceSet, const int chromaTid)
00096 {
00097 
00098   APT_ERR_ASSERT((chromaTid == 1) || (chromaTid == 2), "");
00099 
00100   m_isDescriptive        = true;
00101   m_isMultiAllelic       = false;
00102   m_hasWildCards         = false;
00103   m_type                 = referenceSet.getCallType();
00104   m_copyNumber           = 2;
00105   m_hasZeroCopyNumberNotAvailable = false;
00106 
00107   std::stringstream nameSStr;
00108 
00109   nameSStr << "chromatid" << chromaTid;
00110 
00111   m_name = nameSStr.str();
00112 
00113 
00114   for (int i  = 0; i < gtm.getGeneRowSize(gtm.m_geneName); i++) {
00115 
00116     int row = gtm.getGeneRow(gtm.m_geneName, i);
00117 
00118     // IGNORE previously invalidated experiment rows due to bad probe sets or bases.
00119 
00120     std::string exprProbeSet = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_PROBE_SET_INDEX];
00121 
00122 
00123     // FILTER, only add the element if the GeneCall this CallSet is for
00124     // includes the CallElement in its CompleteSet.
00125 
00126     if (referenceSet.hasProbeSet(exprProbeSet)) {
00127 
00128       std::string allele1 = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE1_INDEX] ;
00129 
00130       bool isWildCardBase = CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1);
00131 
00132       if (!isWildCardBase) {
00133         _setCopyNumber(rte, gtm, row);
00134       }
00135 
00136       if ( (m_copyNumber == 0 ) &&
00137            pcrecpp::RE("NA|NotAvailable").FullMatch(allele1) ) {
00138         m_hasZeroCopyNumberNotAvailable = true;
00139       }
00140 
00141       std::string exprBase;
00142 
00143       if (isWildCardBase || (chromaTid == 1) || (m_copyNumber < 2)) {   // ALLELE1 column
00144         exprBase = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE1_INDEX];
00145 
00146         APT_ERR_ASSERT(!exprBase.empty(), "");
00147 
00148         // Set the base
00149       } else {
00150         // ALLELE2 column
00151         exprBase          = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE2_INDEX];
00152       }
00153 
00154       m_ceSet[exprProbeSet]             = CallElement(exprProbeSet, exprBase);
00155 
00156       if (m_ceSet[exprProbeSet].hasWildCards()) {
00157         m_hasWildCards = true;
00158       }
00159 
00160     }
00161   }
00162 
00163 
00164 }
00165 // end CallSet::CallSet
00166 /*****************************************************************************/
00167 /*****************************************************************************/
00168 /**
00169  * CallSet::addCallElement
00170  * Synopsis:
00171  * 
00172  * Given a row from the Translation Table, adds a CallElement
00173  * ProbeSet/base pair to the CallSet. The element added
00174  * will correspond to the passed in name (take from columns A1-ANN)
00175  * unless reference is specified.
00176  *
00177  * Returns false if the set element being added is a duplicate.
00178  *
00179  * @param ttm - TranslationTableModel raw data that mirors the input TsvFile.
00180  * @param row - the row in question.
00181  * @param base_column - the Allele Name column or Reference column.
00182  * @param allowMultiAllelic - if the element already exists treat the
00183  *                            duplicate ProbeSet as multiAllelic.
00184  *
00185  * @returns true/false - true if successful
00186  */
00187 /*****************************************************************************/
00188 bool CallSet::addCallElement(TranslationTableModel & ttm,
00189                              const int row,
00190                              const int base_column,
00191                              const bool allowMultiAllelic,
00192                              const bool isHaplotype)
00193 {
00194 
00195 
00196   APT_ERR_ASSERT((row >= 0) && (row < ttm.size()), "");
00197   APT_ERR_ASSERT((base_column >= 0) && (base_column < ttm.columnCount()), "");
00198 
00199   bool okToAdd = true;
00200 
00201   std::string probeSet = ttm.m_rows[row][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_PROBE_SET_ID)];
00202 
00203   std::string base = ttm.m_rows[row][base_column];
00204 
00205   bool hasReverseComplement = ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) && (ttm.m_rows[row][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_SWITCH_STRAND)] == "Y"));
00206 
00207   if (isHaplotype) {
00208     m_type = ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP;
00209   }
00210 
00211   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator itFind;
00212 
00213   CallElement testCE(probeSet, base, 2, hasReverseComplement);
00214 
00215   if ((itFind = m_ceSet.find(probeSet)) == m_ceSet.end()) {
00216 
00217     m_ceSet[probeSet] = testCE;
00218 
00219     if (CallElement::isWildCardBase(base)) {
00220       m_hasWildCards = true;
00221     }
00222 
00223   } else if (allowMultiAllelic) {
00224     if (!contains(testCE)) {
00225       okToAdd = m_ceSet[probeSet].addBase(base);
00226     }
00227   } else {
00228     okToAdd = false;
00229   }
00230 
00231   if (okToAdd) {
00232     _setCopyNumber(base);
00233   }
00234 
00235   return okToAdd;
00236 
00237 }
00238 // end CallSet::addCallElement
00239 /*****************************************************************************/
00240 /*****************************************************************************/
00241 /**
00242  * CallSet::buildSecondSet
00243  * Synopsis:
00244  *
00245  * A method used for translation. The idea is that during translation
00246  * alleles in the two chromatid CallSets can be mixed and matched.
00247  * One allele from chromatid 1, the rest from chromatid2 for example.
00248  * This combination is instantiated as a CallSet. This method is
00249  * invoked on the combination CallSet and then the difference
00250  * between the elments in this set and the initial chromatid1 and
00251  * chromatid2 sets is return.
00252  * 
00253  * In other words, given a matched allele set from any combination
00254  * of probeSet/bases from the two chromatid experiment sets for a gene, then
00255  * constructs difference "second" set using the components of both
00256  * not found in the matched set.
00257  *
00258  *
00259  * @param rte - the single instance of the run time enviroment
00260  * @param chromatid1 - from the Genotype experiment data set.
00261  * @param chromatid2 - from the Genotype experiment data set.
00262  */
00263 /*****************************************************************************/
00264 CallSet CallSet::buildSecondSet(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00265                                 const CallSet & chromatid1,
00266                                 const CallSet & chromatid2) const
00267 {
00268 
00269   CallSet secondSet("Difference");
00270 
00271   // Simple case, no wild cards.
00272 
00273   secondSet.m_isDescriptive = true;
00274 
00275   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit;
00276   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator jCEit;
00277   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator kCEit;
00278 
00279   for (iCEit = m_ceSet.begin(); (iCEit != m_ceSet.end()); iCEit++) {
00280 
00281     jCEit = chromatid1.m_ceSet.find(iCEit->first);
00282     kCEit = chromatid2.m_ceSet.find(iCEit->first);
00283     // Ok, all sets are the same size and contain the same ProbeSets in
00284     // precisely the same sorted order. In other words, each set should
00285     // have exactly the same ProbeSets. We assert this.
00286 
00287     APT_ERR_ASSERT((jCEit != chromatid1.m_ceSet.end()) &&
00288                     (kCEit != chromatid2.m_ceSet.end()), "");
00289 
00290 
00291     // Ok, if one is a wild card then both must be a wild card.
00292     // In other words, wild card calls are always homozygous.
00293     if (jCEit->second.hasWildCards()) {
00294       APT_ERR_ASSERT(kCEit->second.hasWildCards(), "");
00295       secondSet.m_ceSet[iCEit->first] = jCEit->second;
00296     } else if (iCEit->second == jCEit->second) {
00297       CallElement newCE = kCEit->second;
00298       newCE.m_chromatid = 2;
00299       secondSet.m_ceSet[iCEit->first] = newCE;
00300     } else if (iCEit->second == kCEit->second) {
00301       CallElement newCE = jCEit->second;
00302       newCE.m_chromatid = 1;
00303       secondSet.m_ceSet[kCEit->first] = newCE;
00304     } else {
00305       APT_ERR_ASSERT(false, "");   // Progammer error, never reached condition.
00306     }
00307 
00308   }
00309   APT_ERR_ASSERT(secondSet.size() == this->size(), "");
00310 
00311   return secondSet;
00312 
00313 }
00314 // CallSet::buildSecondSet

00328   m_isMultiAllelic       = false;
00329   m_hasWildCards         = false;
00330   m_ceSet.clear();
00331 
00332 
00333 }

00337 /**
00338  * CallSet::contains( CallSet )
00339  * Synopsis
00340  *
00341  * A set operator. Detemine if all the CallElements of a CallSet are
00342  * all contained
00343  * within the one being interogated. Calls the "contains" operator
00344  * of each CallElement. See CallSet::contains( CallElement). 
00345  *
00346  *
00347  * @param c - the presumed subset.
00348  *
00349  * @returns true - if c is contained in this CallSet.
00350  */
00351 /*****************************************************************************/
00352 bool CallSet::contains(const CallSet & c) const
00353 {
00354 
00355   bool contained = true;
00356 
00357   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit;
00358 
00359   for (iCEit = c.m_ceSet.begin();
00360        contained && (iCEit != c.m_ceSet.end()); iCEit++) {
00361 
00362     contained = contains(iCEit->second);
00363 
00364   }
00365 
00366   return contained;
00367 
00368 }
00369 // end CallSet::contains
00370 /*****************************************************************************/
00371 /*****************************************************************************/
00372 /**
00373  * CallSet::contains( CallElement )
00374  * Synopsis:
00375  *
00376  * If a CallElement has the same name and the CallElement::operator==
00377  * matches one in this CallSet then the CallElement is said to be
00378  * contained. 
00379  *
00380  * Primarily used in CallSet::contains( CallSet )
00381  *
00382  * @param ce - the CallElement to compare with this CallSet's own list. 
00383  *
00384  * @returns true - if contained
00385  */
00386 /*****************************************************************************/
00387 bool CallSet::contains(const CallElement & ce) const
00388 {
00389 
00390   bool contained = false;
00391 
00392   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit;
00393 
00394   for (iCEit = m_ceSet.begin();
00395        !contained && (iCEit != m_ceSet.end()); iCEit++) {
00396 
00397     if (iCEit->second == ce) {
00398       contained = true;
00399     }
00400 
00401   }
00402 
00403   return contained;
00404 
00405 }
00406 // end CallSet::contains

00409 /**
00410  * CallSet::describeVerbose
00411  *     
00412  * Run time debug routine that can be invoked with various verbose levels.
00413  * ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES is the default level.
00414  *
00415  * @param rte       - run time environment
00416  * @param override  - ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES by default,
00417  *                    otherwise the ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level to output
00418  *
00419  */
00420 /*****************************************************************************/
00421 void CallSet::describeVerbose(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00422                               ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM override) const
00423 {
00424   if (!override && (rte.m_currentVerbosity < ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES))
00425     return;
00426 
00427   if (!override) {
00428     describeVerbose(rte.m_currentVerbosity) ;
00429   } else {
00430     describeVerbose(override);
00431   }
00432 }
00433 // end CallSet::describeVerbose
00434 /*****************************************************************************/
00435 /*****************************************************************************/
00436 /**
00437  * CallSet::describeVerbose
00438  *     
00439  * Run time debug routine that can be invoked with various verbose levels.
00440  * ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES is the default level.
00441  *
00442  * @param level    - ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES by default
00443  *                    otherwise the ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level to output
00444  *
00445  */
00446 /*****************************************************************************/
00447 /*****************************************************************************/
00448 void CallSet::describeVerbose(ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level) const
00449 {
00450 
00451 
00452   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00453 
00454   msgSStr << "CallSet::describeVerbose name: " << m_name << ": ";
00455 
00456   if (m_ceSet.size() == 0) {
00457     msgSStr << " EMPTY ";
00458   } else {
00459     msgSStr << "isDescriptive : " << m_isDescriptive << endl;
00460 
00461     msgSStr << "CallSet::describeVerbose name: " << m_name << ": ";
00462     msgSStr << "CallElement Set size: " << m_ceSet.size() << endl;
00463     msgSStr << "CallSet::describeVerbose name: " << m_name << ": ";
00464     msgSStr << "type: ";
00465     std::string type = "ADT_CALL_TYPE_NULL";
00466     if (m_type == ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER) {
00467       type = "ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER" ;
00468     } else if (m_type == ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP) {
00469       type = "ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP";
00470     }
00471     msgSStr << type;
00472   }
00473 
00474   Verbose::out(level, msgSStr.str());
00475 
00476   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator itCE;
00477 
00478   for (itCE = m_ceSet.begin();
00479        itCE != m_ceSet.end();
00480        ++itCE) {
00481 
00482     itCE->second.describeVerbose(level);
00483 
00484   }
00485 
00486 
00487   return;
00488 
00489 }
00490 // end CallSet::describeVerbose

00493 /**
00494  * CallSet::getProbeSetCallElement
00495  * Synopsis:
00496  *
00497  * A selector to detemine if the set of CallElements contains a
00498  * particular ProbeSet and if so then return a reference to the
00499  * matching CallElement. 
00500  *
00501  * @param probeSet - the probeSet (marker) in question
00502  *
00503  * @return true - if the ProbeSet std::string passed in is in the m_ceSet.
00504  */
00505 /*****************************************************************************/
00506 const CallElement & CallSet::getProbeSetCallElement(const std::string & probeSet) const
00507 {
00508 
00509 
00510   APT_ERR_ASSERT(hasProbeSet(probeSet), "");
00511 
00512   std::map<std::string, CallElement >::const_iterator iCEit = m_ceSet.begin();
00513 
00514   for (; iCEit != m_ceSet.end(); iCEit++) {
00515 
00516     if (iCEit->second.m_probeSet == probeSet) {
00517       break;
00518     }
00519   }
00520 
00521   if (iCEit == m_ceSet.end()) {
00522     APT_ERR_ASSERT(false, "");
00523   }
00524 
00525   return iCEit->second;
00526 
00527 }
00528 // end CallSet::getProbeSetCallElement
00529 /*****************************************************************************/
00530 /*****************************************************************************/
00531 /**
00532  * CallSet::getMarkerProbeSet
00533  * Synopsis
00534  *
00535  * A convienance method that takes advantage of the fact that a
00536  * marker will have only one item in the set and hence just
00537  * returns the first CallElement's name (probeSet id).
00538  * 
00539  * It is an exception to call this API on a non-ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER
00540  * CallSet. 
00541  * 
00542  *
00543  * @returns probeSet - the probeSet  name of the first element in the ceSet.
00544  */
00545 /*****************************************************************************/
00546 std::string CallSet::getMarkerProbeSet() const
00547 {
00548 
00549   APT_ERR_ASSERT(getCallType() == ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER, "");
00550 
00551   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iit;
00552 
00553   iit = m_ceSet.begin();
00554 
00555   return iit->first;
00556 
00557 }
00558 // end CallSet::getMarkerProbeSet
00559 /*****************************************************************************/
00560 /*****************************************************************************/
00561 /**
00562  * CallSet::hasProbeSet
00563  * Synopsis:
00564  *
00565  *  Detemine if the set of CallElements contains a particular ProbeSet.
00566  *
00567  * @param probeSet - the probeSet in question
00568  * 
00569  * @returns true - if the ProbeSet std::string passed in is in the m_ceSet.
00570  */
00571 /*****************************************************************************/
00572 bool CallSet::hasProbeSet(const std::string & probeSet) const
00573 {
00574 
00575 
00576   bool hasProbeSet = false;
00577 
00578   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit = m_ceSet.find(probeSet);
00579 
00580   hasProbeSet = (iCEit != m_ceSet.end());
00581 
00582   return hasProbeSet;
00583 
00584 }
00585 // end CallSet::hasProbeSet
00586 /*****************************************************************************/
00587 /*****************************************************************************/
00588 /**
00589  * CallSet::match
00590  * Synopsis:
00591  *
00592  * The heart of the translation process deep in the guts of
00593  * GeneCall::translate. Detemine if the CallSet can match any combination
00594  * of CallElements given a pair of chromatid CallSets.
00595  *
00596  * If a translation table CallSet matches some combination of chromatid1
00597  * and chromatid2 experiment data CallSet then a match is made. Then
00598  * a call to CallSet::buildSecondSet is made and the diffenerce
00599  * is matched to any of the remaining translation table CallSets for
00600  * for this gene. If not than an "UNK" determination is made. 
00601  *
00602  * @param a - chromatid1 from the CHP 
00603  * @param b - chromatid2 from the CHP
00604  *
00605  * @returns true - if a combination can be made.
00606  */
00607 /*****************************************************************************/
00608 bool CallSet::match(const CallSet & a, const CallSet & b) const
00609 {
00610 
00611   bool match = true;
00612 
00613   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit;
00614   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator c1CEit;
00615   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator c2CEit;
00616 
00617   for (iCEit = m_ceSet.begin(); (iCEit != m_ceSet.end()) && match; iCEit++) {
00618 
00619     c1CEit = a.m_ceSet.find(iCEit->first);
00620     c2CEit = b.m_ceSet.find(iCEit->first);
00621 
00622     APT_ERR_ASSERT((c1CEit != a.m_ceSet.end()) && (c2CEit != b.m_ceSet.end()), "");
00623 
00624     if ((iCEit->second != c1CEit->second) &&
00625         (iCEit->second != c2CEit->second)) {
00626       match = false;
00627     }
00628   }
00629 
00630   return match;
00631 
00632 }
00633 // end CallSet::match
00634 /*****************************************************************************/
00635 /*****************************************************************************/
00636 /**
00637  * CallSet::numWildCars
00638  * Synopsis:
00639  *
00640  * Count the number of wildcard CallElements within the CallSet.
00641  *
00642  * @return numWildCards
00643  *
00644  */
00645 /*****************************************************************************/
00646 int CallSet::numWildCards() const
00647 {
00648 
00649   int numWildCards = 0;
00650 
00651   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit;
00652 
00653   for (iCEit = m_ceSet.begin(); (iCEit != m_ceSet.end()) ; iCEit++) {
00654 
00655     if (iCEit->second.hasWildCards()) {
00656       numWildCards++;
00657     }
00658 
00659   }
00660 
00661   return numWildCards;
00662 
00663 }
00664 // end CallSet::numWildCards
00665 /*****************************************************************************/
00666 /*****************************************************************************/
00667 /**
00668  * CallSet::operator==
00669  *
00670  * Essentially just walk the list of CallElements and comparing all for
00671  * equality, with some added business rules for Copy Number.
00672  *
00673  *
00674  * @param c - The CallSet to compare.
00675  * @returns true - if the CallSets are "equal".
00676  *
00677  */
00678 /*****************************************************************************/
00679 bool CallSet::operator==(const CallSet & c) const
00680 {
00681 
00682   // CallSets can only be equal if they are valid.
00683   if ((! m_isDescriptive) || (! c.m_isDescriptive)) {
00684     return false;
00685   }
00686 
00687   if (m_ceSet.size() != c.m_ceSet.size()) {
00688     return false;
00689   }
00690   // Use the operator== for each CellElement to
00691   // detect if there is a difference.
00692 
00693   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator it1;
00694   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator it2;
00695 
00696   for (it1 = m_ceSet.begin();  it1 != m_ceSet.end();   it1++, it2++) {
00697 
00698     it2 = c.m_ceSet.find(it1->first);
00699 
00700     if (it2 == c.m_ceSet.end()) {
00701       return false;
00702     }
00703 
00704     if ((it1->second != it2->second)) {
00705       return false;
00706     }
00707   }
00708 
00709   return true;
00710 }
00711 // CallSet::operator==
00712 /*****************************************************************************/
00713 /*****************************************************************************/
00714 /**
00715  * CallSet::_setCopyNumber:
00716  * Synopsis:
00717  *
00718  *   Sets the call number to 0, 1 or 2 for the entire gene based on
00719  * experiment data. One probeset's copy number sets the entire
00720  * CallSet because copy number is
00721  * the same for the the entire gene set of markers.
00722  * 
00723  * Experiment CHP data should never contain varying copy number
00724  * types. However, hand crafted data may contain varying copy number
00725  * states. This routine will set the copy state to the lowest
00726  * number possible (0) when called repeatedly. Once copy number 0
00727  * is established then that's it. All markers will then be treated
00728  * as copy nuber 0 regardless of actual data values. 
00729  *
00730  *
00731  * @param rte - The RunTimeEnvironment
00732  * @param gtm - the experiment records for one gene.
00733  * @param row - the row in the gtm
00734  *
00735  * @return - void, sets member value "m_copyNumber".
00736  */
00737 /*****************************************************************************/
00738 void CallSet::_setCopyNumber(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00739                              GenotypeTableModel & gtm,
00740                              const int row)
00741 {
00742 
00743 
00744   // If any previous determination of copy number 0 was reached
00745   // then it applies to an entire haplotpye group.
00746 
00747 
00748   if ( gtm.m_geneCopyNumber.count(gtm.m_geneName) > 0 ) {
00749     m_copyNumber = gtm.m_geneCopyNumber[gtm.m_geneName];
00750     return;
00751   }
00752   
00753   if (m_copyNumber == 0) {
00754     return;
00755   }
00756 
00757   std::string allele1Base = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE1_INDEX];
00758   std::string allele2Base = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE2_INDEX];
00759 
00760   if (allele1Base.empty() || CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1Base)) {
00761     return;
00762   }
00763 
00764   if (allele1Base == "0") {
00765     m_copyNumber = 0;
00766   } else if (allele2Base.empty()) {
00767     m_copyNumber = 1;
00768   }
00769 
00770   return;
00771 }
00772 // end CallSet::_setCopyNumber
00773 /*****************************************************************************/
00774 /*****************************************************************************/
00775 /**
00776  * _setCopyNumber:
00777  * Synopsis:
00778  *
00779  *   Sets the call number to 0 if base is "0";
00780  *
00781  *
00782  * @param base - the allele "base", could be "0".
00783  *
00784  * @return - void, sets member value "m_copyNumber".
00785  */
00786 /*****************************************************************************/
00787 void CallSet::_setCopyNumber(const std::string & base)
00788 {
00789 
00790 
00791   if (base == "0") {
00792     m_copyNumber = 0;
00793   }
00794 
00795   return;
00796 }
00797 // end CallSet::_setCopyNumber
00798 /*****************************************************************************/
